title: Client's size feedback, Too small
body: I'd really like if we could modify the client's size, for me the alpha client feels small

replies.body:
I personally can't see any option in the settings either.

https://i.imgsafe.org/0565fe04ae.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Credo,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=dEz3VEAv,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-14T01:42:22.260+0000)
>
> Its adjustable via the settings. :)

Where in the settings? I also find it tiny, but am unable to drag to resize, and don't see any size options in the in-client settings. Note: I find it tiny, as I play on 1440p, which makes the client pretty much too small to read most things.
I'd love to see the client fullscreen! I think that would help make time inbetween matches feel more like "you're still in the game" even when you're not in a game.

Said this is another post but I would like it if Riot can make it so the new Client can detect your Native Resolution. That way if say you are playing on a 1920x1080 monitor it will choose the 1600x900 resolution (which is the closet to 1080p on the presets) instead of the 720p.

I'd just like to compare the size of the [client in a 1080p environment](http://puu.sh/rLu86/6e97915cbb.jpg) (which is fine and can be easily read)  versus the size of the [client in a 1440p environment](http://puu.sh/rLu8N/e24f1a22bc.jpg) (which is small and difficult to read, especially when I'm sitting back in my chair at a proper distance from the screen).

Also, yes, I definitely cannot see any options related the changing the size of the client, as other users have mentioned. Can we get a response on this? If there are indeed options to change the size, I'd like to know where, as this is currently making me unable to test the Alpha client. I literally just can't see any of the details at the size it's defaulting to.

Note: This comparison is just to provide a frame of reference between the two sizes. If you're viewing the screenshot on a 1080p monitor, the 1440p image is going to appear huge and very easy to read. The point here is the size of the client in reference to the size of the screen around it.
It's too big for me, I have to hide my dock to see the bottom of it

For me the client is at a good resolution, but it takes up so much of my screen that part of it hides behind the window's bar at the bottom. I had a hard time clicking buttons that were near the bottom of the screen, in particular the buttons to start a match. I saw Riot Credo mentioned something about the settings, but I couldn't find anything involving "client size" or "client resolution."
